text: in writing. ‒ I want to Stress with my vote the absolute need to prevent irreversible damage to the VNP, which was designated by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site in 1979 and as a World Heritage Site in Danger in 1994. I deplore the fact that the VNP has also become one of the most dangerous places in the world when it comes to wildlife conservation; I note with deep concern that armed groups have been involved in illegal exploitation of the park’s natural resources through mining activities and charcoal production used both to sustain their military operations and for personal gain. I also deplore the fact that armed groups have been involved in large-scale poaching for food purposes and for war-sustaining trade in ivory and bush meat. Let me emphasises that irreversible damage to the VNP could occur as a result of the exploration and exploitation of oil or other illegal activities.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. This motion for a resolution calls on SOCO International and its DRC-registered company to permanently cease all exploration and exploitation in Virunga Park and to respect the park's current boundaries; it also calls on the DRC government to revoke oil exploration permits. It calls on the DRC government to disarm the rebels and restore security in the park area, but also urges it to recognize and respect freedom of the press and media and to defend the rule of law and human rights. It calls on the European Union to help the DRC government. It calls on the Commission and Member States to take legally binding measures to make companies bypassing national laws and international treaties their responsibilities. I vote in defense of this ecological sanctuary.

name: István UJHELYI
text: Writing. \u2012 Virunga National Park is africa's oldest national park and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in north Kivu Province of the Democratic Republic of congo and orientale province on the border with Rwanda and Uganda. It is famous worldwide for its unique habitats and rich biodiversity, being africa's most biodiversity park. He's especially famous for the mountain gorillas that live there. The European Commission and some EU Member States have supported the maintenance of the park over the last 25 years. I supported the resolution on his defence.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution because I recognise the status of the Virunga national park as a protected wilderness; shamefully the park has been under threat for decades by armed groups that engage in poaching, deforestation and other forms of unsustainable and illegal resource exploitation. As a result, Virunga has been included on the List of World Heritage Sites in Danger. I also recognise that the Virunga park has an annual economic value of USD 48.9 million and, in a stable situation, the park could contribute to growth in the economy and in tourism, and could have a value of USD 1 billion per year and create 45 000 jobs. I believe we need to preserve the park and uphold its integrity, therefore I supported the calls for increasing the commitment to funding sustainable conservation and economic development and diversification of the surrounding region. We should at the same time support the DRC Government in developing sustainable energy and economic alternatives to extractive industries, in improving the mobilisation of domestic resources, especially through fair and progressive tax systems and in combating poaching, illegal logging, illegal mining and corruption, which are persistent factors that could cause irreversible damage to the park.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. U2012 We are talking about a Resolution that aims to highlight the important need for the protection of Virunga National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1979, and which today faces threats of exploitation and exploration that put it in grave danger. That is why I consider it necessary to vote in favour of that resolution.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. The Virunga National Park is not only africa's oldest national park, it is also one of the most biodiverse and unique national parks in the world. The future of this beautiful park and its riches are under severe pressure. Armed conflicts, corruption and unbridled economic interests are a major threat to the park and its endangered species. Over the past decade, more than 150 rangers have been killed on duty. Those who denounce the government's culpable failure to act are threatened, intimidated or jailed for no reason. I call on the Congolese authorities to investigate and bring to justice the threats and violence against the rangers. In my opinion, the Congolose government must do everything in its part to stop and prevent irreparable damage to the Virunga National Park as a result of the exploration and exploitation of oil or other illegal activities.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. Two-thirds of the world's known oil reserves are in the Middle East. But dependence on this area is unacceptable from a strategic point of view, according to the imperial powers. Thus, major multinational oil companies are clearly involved in the search for new oil reserves. In 2010, the Government of Congo signed oil exploration contracts in areas covering 85% of the Virunga park area, although the Democratic Republic of Congo Act prohibits any exploitation in this park, which is considered a world heritage site by UNESCO. This park is now threatened, in particular by concessions given to multinationals Total and Soco, among others. With respect for the sovereignty of all the countries involved, and in particular the Democratic Republic of congo, it is our duty to seek to ensure policies for the exploitation of resources at the service of local populations and not at the service of the accumulation of profits by multinationals, which do not look at ways to corrupt governments or destabilise entire regions to reach their ends.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. The preservation of this national park is very important. The natural flora and fauna of the national park is already very threatened. The report should help to ensure that conservation is successful. I am therefore in favour of this report.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the resolution on the protection of Virunga National Park. It is the oldest national park in Africa, home to many endangered species, such as mountain gorillas. And it is extremely sad that it has long been threatened by armed rebels looting it for the purpose of monetising ivory or mineral wealth, but also by European companies trying to extract oil under the guise of scientific activity. Such practices are not only a breach of the treaties by which companies have been allowed to extract oil in Congo, but also an demonstration of an absolute lack of respect for nature. That is also why we call on companies to honour commitments and stop harmful activities on the territory of the park, to the government not to issue mining permits and to maintain the boundaries of the park and its natural assets for future generations.

name: Inês Cristina ZUBER
text: in writing. Virunga National Park (PNV) is the oldest national park in Africa. Classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1979 and a world heritage site in danger in 1994, it is the park with the greatest biodiversity on the African continent. For decades, the PNV has been under threat from armed groups. In 2007, the threat of danger to the PNV increases with the allocation of oil concessions by the GOVERNMENT of the DRC, which cover 85% of the park, despite existing legislation, which prohibits the practice of activities harmful to the environment in protected areas. However, the prospecting licence granted to SOCO International plc benefits from an exception provided for by law, which allows the performance of "scientific" activities in protected areas. A report by Global Witness, published in September 2014, stated that there are allegations that SOCO and its contractors made illicit payments. The situation experienced in the PNV is another painful demonstration of the inhuman, exploitative and aggressive character of the capitalist system. Despite condemning SOCO for the activities of prospecting and exploiting PNV resources and asking it to publicly commit to cancelling them on a permanent basis, the resolution proves much tougher on the DRC Government than on the British-based company. We abstained.

name: Ioan Mircea PAŞCU
text: The period devoted to explanations of votes has ended.
